title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire - BBC News
summary: busiest travel day of easter holidays .
six new free schools for county .
goring cigar case to be auctioned .

documents.title: easter drivers told to expect traffic jams
text: easter drivers told to expect traffic jams

documents.title: goodbye for the week
text: that 's all from the team providing regular updates of news , travel , sport and weather in northamptonshire for this week .
here 's a recap of some of the stories we 've been covering - scroll down for more :
we 'll be back from 08:00 on tuesday .
have a great easter .

documents.title: new mayor for wellingborough announced
text: the name of the mayor of wellingborough has been announced .
councillor paul bell ( centre back at the opening of glamis hall in the town ) , who has served on the borough council of wellingborough since 2003 , takes up the annual role .
he will raise money for links day centre for adults with learning disabilities and the mencap wellingborough gateway club during his year as mayor , which will begin on 23 may .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: cash machine explosion 'started by gas canister '
text: an explosion at a cash machine is believed to have been started by a gas canister , police have said .
as we reported , thieves targeted the cash point at a petrol station at crown park , northampton road , rushden , in the early hours of today .
northants police said a `` significant '' amount of damage was caused to the cash machine and it is not known how much cash was stolen .
an investigation is under way and the force is asking witnesses to come forward .
no-one was hurt in the incident .

documents.title: explosion targets cash machine in rushden
text: police are appealing for witnesses following an incident at a petrol station in northampton road , rushden , earlier today .
officers were called to crown park at about 03:45 following reports of an explosion targeting a cash machine .
emergency services attended to make the area safe and no-one was hurt in the incident .
an investigation is under way .

documents.title: hermann goring cigar case to be auctioned off
text: a rare silver cigar case that belonged to leading nazi hermann goring is to be auctioned in northamptonshire .
whittlebury-based auctioneer jp humbert will be putting the presentation case , emblazoned with the family coat of arms of both goring and his wife emmy , up for offer in may .
it was presented to goring on his 50th birthday in 1943 by luftwaffe field marshall erhard milch , whose father was jewish and who enjoyed goring 's `` protection '' .
goring was the founder of the gestapo and in charge of the german air force until the end of world war two .
while on trial in nuremburg on charges including crimes against humanity , he committed suicide .

jonathan humbert said : `` this is an historic museum piece that belonged to one of history 's most notorious individuals and was presented to him by milch - who would never be able to reconcile his position within the nazi party and his own jewish ancestry .
`` we anticipate much interest from museums , institutions and private collectors .

`` while we are always mindful of those who suffered at the hands of the nazi regime , this cigar box serves as reminder of the excesses of the high-ranking individuals and those who sought to ingratiate themselves with them . ''
the box will be up for sale as part of an international militaria auction on 25 may and is expected to bring in £ 800-1,200 .

documents.title: rory mcleod qualifies for world snooker championships
text: wellingborough 's rory mcleod has qualified for the world snooker championships , which starts at the crucible in sheffield on saturday .
he came through he qualification last night , beating hammad miah 10-7 , and will find out this morning who 'll he face in the first round .
mcleod told me : `` whenever you get to the crucible it is going to be a major experience for any snooker player .
`` to get there after winning three [ qualification ] matches , i 'm going to be buzzing . ''
for more on the world championship , visit the bbc 's snooker session .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: dylan hartley says saints european bid is his focus , not lions
text: northampton saints hooker dylan hartley says he is concentrating on guiding his side to at least a european champions cup position in the premiership .
saints are seventh in the table , but level on points with sixth-placed harlequins .
the england captain says he wo n't let possible selection for the british & irish lions have an impact on that aim .
`` it 's an uncontrollable , '' he said .
`` the selectors have got a pretty difficult job .
`` what i can control is what i do this weekend against saracens , every other player is thinking that as well .
`` [ representative rugby ] is the bonus of playing well off the back of club rugby or for your international side .
`` it 's not my job to worry about selection - it 's my job to play well . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: hartley 'not building himself up ' over possible lions place
text: england captain dylan hartley says it would be a `` bonus '' to be selected for the british & irish lions tour of new zealand this summer .
hartley , 31 , led eddie jones ' side to the six nations championship last month and will finish the premiership season with his club side northampton .
lions head coach warren gatland names his touring party next week .
`` i 'm not building myself up for possibly what would be a setback in my eyes , '' hartley said .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: deadline to register to vote looms
text: today is the last day to register to vote in the local elections on 4 may .
elections will take place for seats on northamptonshire county council , as well as for the by-election for the long buckby ward on daventry district council .
people can register to vote online at www.gov.uk/registertovote .

documents.title: new free schools : 'quality teaching , not just classrooms , needed '
text: the northamptonshire chairman of the national union of teachers says he 's concerned six new free schools in the county would be allowed to put unqualified teachers into classrooms to save money .
proponents say the new schools are needed to address excess demand , but gordon white told me the quality of teaching , not just new classrooms , is key .
he said : `` if there are downward pressures on funding the temptation is to use cheaper staff and even unqualified staff . ''
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: new free schools : 'real demand on primary places '
text: julia kedwards , the chief executive of northampton primary academy trust which will be running the new harlestone road free school , has been telling me what such schools are and why they are needed in northamptonshire .
free schools are controlled locally by multi-academy trusts or academy groups , as opposed to a local authority .
mrs kedwards said this means `` they have more autonomy , more control over how schools are run '' and can share best-practice .
she said such schools are needed in the county as there is `` real demand '' on primary school places .
`` of our seven primary schools , four have already expanded , '' she said .
`` that demand is expected to increase .
`` we are at a critical point where we need to create capacity . ''
for more details on what free schools are see the bbc 's article on 'what is the rationale behind free schools ? '
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: new free schools : where they will be situated
text: i 've got some more details on the six new free schools planned for northamptonshire .
they consist of two new primaries in northampton at buckton fields and in the harlestone road area .
new homes are being constructed in both of these areas prompting the need for schools .
in wellingborough , there will be a new secondary age special school , run by the friars multi-academy trust and aiming to have spaces for 145 pupils .
there will also be three mainstream secondaries - at sponne in daventry , houghton gate in northampton and the corby secondary academy .
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: new free schools to be set up in northamptonshire
text: six new free schools are to be set up in the county , consisting of two primaries , three secondaries and a secondary age special school .
yesterday , the department for education gave the nod for 131 free schools nationally , including a new state boarding school .
all the schools in northamptonshire are brand new and as yet do n't have any premises .
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northants 'chubsters ' putting mental health over physical fitness and it 's reaping rewards
text: northamptonshire 's cricketers started this season with an emphatic two-day win over glamorgan - and the daily telegraph 's scyld berry has been celebrating the success of the county 's `` larger than life '' players .
or 'chubsters ' as coach david ripley describes them
author: The Daily Telegraph

documents.title: planning an easter trip today ? watch out for the roadworks
text: planning to beat the crowds and take to the roads and railways today ahead of the easter break ?
if so , you may already be too late
today is the busiest day for the great getaway , with more than 20 million cars expected to be on the roads and more than 200 rail engineering works taking place over easter .
among the longest stretches of roadworks over easter is the m1 at crick , which is home to more than 15 miles of work .
author: Daniel Wainwright
Data unit - English regions

documents.title: thursday 's weather : early sunshine before it clouds over
text: there 'll be some sunshine , but make the most of it , as cloud will increase as we go through the afternoon .
the cool north westerly wind may bring a little drizzle much later on , but mostly we 've got a dry day ahead of us .
top temperature : 12c ( 54f ) .
watch my full regional forecast here :
author: Sara Thornton
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome back : northamptonshire live
text: good morning and welcome to another day of live updates from across northamptonshire .
we 'll be here from now until 18:00 bringing you the very latest news , sport , weather and travel .
we 'll have the latest weather for you soon , as well as some news about our potentially busy roads ahead of the easter weekends .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: ironworks cultural hub approved
text: ironworks cultural hub approved

documents.title: lions call-up a 'bonus ' for hartley
text: lions call-up a 'bonus ' for hartley

documents.title: goodbye for today
text: that 's all from the team providing regular updates of news , travel , sport and weather in northamptonshire .
we 'll be back fully from 08:00 tomorrow , but any breaking stories will appear here overnight .
have a good evening .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northamptonshire poet 's long-lost novel resurfaces
text: a little-known novel by the northamptonshire `` peasant poet '' john clare has been restored and is set to be published .
john clare was born in 1793 in helpston in the soke of peterborough , which was in northamptonshire at that time .
he is best known for poems celebrating the countryside and lamenting its destruction , but he once had a go at writing a novel .
`` the memoirs of uncle barnaby '' was abandoned after 10 years of writing .
it was recently uncovered at peterborough central library and there are plans to publish the work .
a talk about the novel is taking place in peterborough tonight .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : much colder overnight and sunny spells tomorrow
text: this evening will be rather cloudy with the chance of a few spots of light rain .
skies will clear later , leaving low overnight temperatures of 3c - that 's 37f .
tomorrow will start chilly but it will be mainly dry with sunny spells and the odd isolated shower .
highs of 12c , that 's 54f .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: progress on key rail bridge
text: an important element of the construction of the stanton cross rail bridge has been completed .
the bridge will become part of a key route between the new stanton cross development and wellingborough town centre .
two concrete pumps were used to lay 146 cubic metres of concrete over the structure in an operation that took place overnight .
the bridge 's beams were lifted into place earlier this year by a 1100t crane , one of only three in the country .

a spokesperson for bovis homes , the developers , said `` the rail bridge is an integral part of the first major infrastructure road accessing stanton cross and is expected to be complete and open to traffic early in 2018 '' .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: kettering general will 'improve at pace '
text: the organisation that 's placed kettering general hospital in special measures says it will provide support to make sure the facility makes rapid improvements to patient services .
the cqc had recommended putting kgh in special measures after inspectors graded the hospital `` inadequate '' .
the report found there was a lack of adequate management when risks to patients were identified - but did say the majority of staff there were hard-working , passionate and caring .
nhs improvement says it 's targeting its efforts on the emergency department and young people 's services , which were identified as particular areas of concern .

kathy mclean ( above ) , the executive medical director at nhs improvement , said : `` patient safety remains our top priority , and each of the report 's concerns will be addressed through our support package to the trust . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: power cut in daventry
text: about 400 properties have been affected by a power cut in daventry this afternoon .
western power says supplies should be restored by about 17:30 .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: calf stolen from field
text: a calf is still missing after being taken from a field near daventry over the weekend .
the three and a half month old ginger south devon calf disappeared from a field between little brington and whilton on saturday night .
police are appealing for witnesses to come forward .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: egg-cited ambulance worker gets in the easter spirit
text: we 've spotted this seasonal costume sported by a 999 call-handler
one of our off-duty emergency call handlers has dressed up as a chick to bring some easter cheer to their colleagues on duty !
# teamemas
what an egg-cellent idea !
# goodegg
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: cultural centre gets go-ahead in northampton
text: a major project to turn a disused northampton iron works into a cultural centre has been given planning permission .
the existing listed vulcan works building on guildhall road will be turned into a centre for creative leather technology , and there will also be commercial units for creative businesses .
it 's hoped construction work will start later this year and the site will eventually provide 300 jobs .
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: expert thumbs-up for single-bin scheme
text: a waste management expert says plans to reduce the number of bins at each house in northampton should lead to more waste being recycled .
at the moment residents have to sort their waste into up to five different containers .
the arrangements are slightly different for terraced houses with no rear access .
however , the rubbish collection contract is coming to an end and councillors will decide tonight whether to tender for a new system involving a single recycling bin .

prof margaret bates from the university of northampton , said : `` it 's really about making it easier for the householder , so you do n't need to decide which bin other than it 's recycling it goes in .
`` you just do it , and hopefully it will increase recycling rates . ''
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: jobless total falls in east mids
text: the number of unemployed people in the east midlands region , which includes northamptonshire , fell by 11,000 in the last quarter .
there are now 96,000 people in the region without a job .
the national jobless total dropped by 45,000 in the quarter to february to 1.56 million - a reduction of 141,000 since a year ago and the lowest since the end of 2006 .
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: cook available for start of essex season
text: cook available for start of essex season

documents.title: patients defend 'inadequate ' hospital
text: patients and their families have been telling us about their experiences of kettering general hospital ( kgh ) after inspectors labelled it `` inadequate '' .
it 's been recommended the hospital is placed in special measures after concerns were raised about leadership and safety .
we spoke to several people who visited the site yesterday .
here 's some of their views
`` they do a good job , they 're very attentive .
my mum broke her hip a couple of times and , if there 's a problem , they 're onto it . ''
`` my mum broke her hand and she received very good care . ''
`` the treatment is very good here - compassionate and caring .
the service is incredible . ''
the inspection report found staff were hard-working and passionate , but had to struggle against the pressures they faced .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: large increase in a & e cases at 'inadequate ' hospital
text: managers at kettering general hospital say their accident and emergency department has dealt with 1,000 more patients each month since their last official inspection .
the latest report on the performance of kgh found that urgent and emergency services were inadequate .
the chief inspector has recommended that the hospital be placed in special measures .
the inspectors said the a & e facilities :
leanne hackshall ( above ) , the director of nursing and quality at kgh , said : `` we 've seen a 1,000-patient increase per month since the last cqc inspection .

`` it 's forced us to open additional escalation areas , so , given the national regarding staffing and recruitment , trying to share our staff across additional areas does add an additional pressure . ''

documents.title: director to be brought in to improve kettering general hospital
text: a improvement director will be appointed to lead kettering general hospital after inspectors labelled the facility `` inadequate '' .
the chief inspector of hospitals , prof sir mike richards , said there were particular concerns about leadership and safety and recommended the hospital be put into special measures .

the vice-chairman of the hospital trust that runs kettering , stephen ramsden ( above ) , said : `` we 'll get an experienced director who 's worked around the health service in the quality and safety agenda .
hopefully , that will be in place really soon .
`` we 'll have identified other nhs organisations that are seen to be doing really well in areas such as governance and risk , which is where we were criticised .
`` we 'll be given help from some better performing organisations . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: hospital criticised for safety standards
text: hospital criticised for safety standards

documents.title: kettering general has 'taken corrective action '
text: kettering general hospital 's medical director said the trust had already made improvements following a care quality commission inspection which rated it `` inadequate '' overall .
dr andrew chilton said : `` our patients and the public will feel justifiably concerned in view of this report .
`` however we have not stood still during this time , the inspection took place in october and since then we 've taken swift corrective action .
`` what the report will demonstrate and hopefully very clearly is that our staff are caring , compassionate and professional . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: kettering general : a 'number of serious problems ' found
text: the chief inspector of hospitals , prof sir mike richards , said there were `` a number of serious problems '' in the services run by kettering general hospital nhs foundation trust , before he recommended that the trust should be placed into special measures .

`` we made nhs improvement ( nhsi ) aware of our concerns following the inspection and it has begun to work with the trust to make sure these are appropriately addressed and that progress is monitored , '' he said .
my inspection team found that the majority of staff were hard-working , passionate and caring , but had to struggle against the pressures they faced . ''
prof richards said staff treated patients with `` dignity and respect '' so rated the trust as `` good '' for being caring , but it was rated `` inadequate '' for being well-led and safe .
`` risks to patients were not always identified and when they were identified , there was a lack of adequate management of these , '' he said .
`` in addition , there was a lack of learning from incidents to prevent patient harm .
this was particularly the case in the emergency department , outpatients and services for children and young people . ''
he said the trust had been receiving support from nhs improvement and managers said they had `` listened to our inspectors ' findings and have begun to take action where it is required '' .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: kettering general hospital to be placed in special measures
text: england 's chief inspector of hospitals has recommended that kettering general be placed in special measures after the care quality commission ( cqc ) rated the nhs foundation trust as `` inadequate '' overall - the lowest rating .
following inspections carried out in october 2016 , the cqc found the trust needed to make urgent improvements in a number of areas .
there were several concerns in the emergency department , which was rated inadequate overall .

inspectors found insufficient staffing levels to meet the needs of patients and no effective processes in place to make sure patients who self-presented to the a & e were safe to wait up to two hours to see a clinician .
urgent improvements were also needed in services for children and young people .
some patients also experienced long delays waiting for treatment , specifically for urology , maxillofacial and ear , nose and throat .

although inspectors decided the majority of staff were hard-working , passionate and caring , the trust was rated `` inadequate '' for being safe and well-led and `` requires improvement '' for being effective and responsive .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : bright start with thickening cloud
text: a bright start this morning , but cloud will thicken through the day to leave things fairly dull this afternoon with a few spits and spots of light rain by the early evening .
highs of 14c , that 's 57f .
later on tonight , the outbreaks of showery rain will move away leading it to turn clearer and colder , with patches of frost in rural areas .
check out the bbc weather website for the latest forecast for where you live .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates from northamptonshire
text: good morning and welcome to another day of live updates from beds , herts and bucks .
we 'll be here from now until 18:00 bringing you the very latest news , sport , weather and travel .
this morning , we 'll be bringing you the news that the chief inspector of hospitals has recommended that kettering general be placed in special measures .
but first , as always , there 'll be a full regional weather forecast .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: grandmother drowned 'rescuing dog '
text: grandmother drowned 'rescuing dog '

documents.title: that 's all from the bbc local live team in the county
text: that 's it for the live stream today .
we 'll be back on the desk at 08:00 on wednesday but , of course , any breaking news from across northamptonshire will still appear here overnight .
have a good evening and see you tomorrow .

documents.title: weather : cloudy overnight with bright spells tomorrow
text: it should be a fine end to the day and staying dry this evening , although there could be some patchy light rain by the end of the night .
temperatures falling to about 6c , that 's 43f .
tomorrow will be cloudy with some bright spells , but with the cloud increasing from the north we could see some showery outbreaks .
highs of 14c , that 's 57f .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: plans 'being worked on ' for production after actor 's sudden death , says theatre
text: as we told you earlier , we 've been trying to find out the latest plans for a production at northampton 's royal and derngate theatre following the death of actor tim pigott-smith .

the theatre has just sent through this statement : `` we are contacting all ticket holders directly to let them know that there will be no performances going ahead of death of a salesman at royal and derngate until 18 april at the earliest .
`` we continue to work on plans for the production 's future and will update more when we are able .
thank you for your patience and understanding . ''
the bafta award-winning actor died on friday , aged 70 .
previews of the play were due to open last night .
author: Zoe Applegate
BBC News

documents.title: breakingtaxi driver cleared over ballet star jonathan ollivier 's death
text: a taxi driver has been cleared of causing the death of northampton ballet star jonathan ollivier by careless driving .
ollivier , 38 , suffered fatal head injuries after his motorbike was involved in a crash with a car in clerkenwell , central london , on his way to a performance in august 2015 .
the cab driver was abdul qayyum , 44 , from slough , berkshire .
he was found not guilty of death by careless driving after a trial at the old bailey in london .
ollivier made his name with matthew bourne 's company new adventures , playing the swan in swan lake and speight in play without words .
he had been on his way to perform in bourne 's production of the car man at sadler 's wells theatre .
after the accident , the choreographer described ollivier as `` one of the most charismatic and powerful dancers of his generation '' .

documents.title: breakingvictims of double-fatal crash near creaton named
text: two people killed in a three-vehicle road crash in northamptonshire on sunday have been named by police .
guy marriott , 25 , of theddingworth , leicestershire , and sophie griffin , 22 , of lutterworth , also in leicestershire , both died on the a5199 welford road , near creaton .
it 's believed mr marriott was driving a blue vauxhall corsa and ms griffin was a passenger .
the crash happened at about 20:45 and also involved a blue hyundai i40 and white peugeot partner van .
northamptonshire police is appealing for any witnesses of the crash - or anyone who spotted the vehicles beforehand - to get in touch .
author: Zoe Applegate
BBC News

documents.title: couple to be sentenced in may over child sex and drug offences
text: a northampton couple found guilty of 84 child sex and drug charges are to be sentenced next month .
nicholas taylor , 47 , and his wife joan taylor , 44 , were convicted in march of carrying out a decade of sex and drug abuse against children as young as 11 .
leicester crown court was told the `` master manipulators '' carried out the string of crimes between 1996 and 2006 - during when children were given crack cocaine .
the couple will be sentenced on 8 may .
author: Zoe Applegate
BBC News

documents.title: announcement expected on production following actor 's death
text: we have just been on the phone to northampton 's royal and derngate theatre to find out if a play due to star actor tim pigott-smith will still go ahead following his sudden death on friday .

previews of arthur miller 's death of a salesman were due to start last night , having originally been postponed from saturday after the star 's actress wife pamela miles broke a bone during rehearsals .
the theatre said a statement is due to be released later today - we will update you with the latest as soon as we have it .

documents.title: take one : free film-making workshops
text: if you 're a sucker for a selfie or snap happy with your phone or camera , then a bit of professional advice will never go amiss .
young people between 10 and 18 in the county are being offered free film-making workshops later this month , run by screen northants .
a film industry professional will lead the six-week courses covering film and photography skills - with the chance to produce a short film up for grabs too .

documents.title: listen : hoax 999 caller claimed girl had died
text: the east midlands ambulance service is asking parents to talk to their children about not making hoax 999 calls .
it 's after the air ambulance , a fast response paramedic and two ambulances were sent out to this 999 call , voiced here by actors
emas said the call on friday cost the emergency service nearly £ 2,500 and saw an ambulance diverted from a real emergency where someone was experiencing chest pains .
emas said they received a further three hoax calls from children yesterday .
hoax calls can put people 's lives in danger by diverting resources away from genuine emergencies and can delay responses attending serious or life threatening emergency calls .
they also place additional strain on emergency services at a time when the trust is dealing with a rising number of 999 calls .
think - your life , or the life of someone you care about , could be put at risk by making a hoax call . ''
emas said police are aware of this hoax call .
it refused to say where the call was made .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: photos : eddie stobart anti-fracking daventry demonstration
text: about a dozen anti-fracking demonstrators gathered at eddie stobart 's haulage depot near daventry earlier today .
four people laid in the road to block the barriers to the daventry international rail freight terminal ( dirft ) in protest at the transport firm delivering equipment to a test site in lancashire .
the demonstrators , thought to be from leicestershire , turned out at 06:45 and called off the protest about four hours later after one of the firm 's managers read out a statement .
i took these photos of the scene .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'fancy a tattoo ? '
text: this has to be one of the best overheard conversations ever
presenter and northamptonshire vicar richard coles has been taking in the sights and sounds of the cambridgeshire town of st ives .
two old ladies in # stives walking down the street .
`` fancy lunch ? ''
`` no , i fancy a tattoo .
little tasmanaisn devil '' .
if you 're in st.ives you must go to tom 's cakes .
by hsbc .
best victoria sponge ever !
two old ladies , 'that 's rev richard coles . '
'ooh , let 's see if we can get him to tweet about us . '
not what i imagined for 'old ladies ' .
i wonder where she wanted it ?
have n't you met a man with seven wives
rockabilly cafe - small but perfectly formed .
tassie
i recommend warrens bakery if you 're peckish

documents.title: anti-fracking protesters disrupt eddie stobart 's daventry depot
text: anti-fracking demonstrators blockaded an eddie stobart haulage depot near daventry this morning .
they closed off entrances and exits to the firm 's site at daventry international rail freight terminal ( dirft ) to protest against the firm 's equipment deliveries to .
cuadrilla 's test site .
for fracking in lancashire .

eddie stobart then issued a statement saying three deliveries in march had been sub-contracted by them for the cuadrilla site , but they had no plans to make any future deliveries to that or any other test fracking site .
the protesters , believed to be from leicestershire , left shortly afterwards , but said they would return if eddie stobart changes its position .
police said no arrests were made .

documents.title: woman punched and robbed in park by masked attackers
text: a woman was punched in the face and mugged by masked robbers as she walked across a park in northampton yesterday morning .
the victim was walking alone on the racecourse when she was attacked and robbed of her handbag by two men , who then fled on a scooter .
the pair , dressed in dark clothes , rode off on the grey or silver vehicle towards brick kiln lane after striking between there and bailiff street , from about 11:40 to midday .
northamptonshire police is appealing for anyone with information to come forward .

documents.title: hammer seized in kettering during weapon crackdown
text: yesterday we told you how northamptonshire police officers had been tweeting about some of the weapons they had seized on the streets of corby and kettering - including an axe and a machete .
the force 's proactive team - a unit of plain-clothed officers covering the county - has been leading the crackdown .
last week officers revealed .
how they confiscated a nine-inch knife from a 12-year-old boy .
in corby .
here 's the latest tweet in their series - published this morning .
seized during a # stopsearch in the early hours in kettering .
guess you never know when you 'll need to do a spot of diy !
no nails located .
13 shifts in kettering = 10 knives,1 machete,1 axe,7 other weapons .
various drugs,29 arrests,55 stop searches,21 premises search # protect
omg when will people stop carrying ?
this is terrifying , had no idea what you brave guys and girls really face every day .
thank you .
nice work
well done - much better to be proactive rather than reactive !
thank you .

documents.title: leather institute plans would 'invigorate ' town 's heart
text: the proposal to bring northampton 's traditional leather industry back into the heart of the town would `` invigorate '' it , according to an academic .
plans to convert the vulcan works buildings into a creative industries hub for the .
university of northampton 's institute for creative leather technologies .
will be discussed by the borough council tonight from 18:00 .
units for other creative industries will also be built , along with a new three-storey building on angel street .
rachel garwood , director of the university 's institute of creative leather technologies , said : `` it 's really exciting to bring leather back to the centre of northampton .
`` it will invigorate northampton , add to the cultural quarter and give the student a better experience . ''

documents.title: cultural centre plans for northampton move closer
text: plans to create a new cultural centre for northampton should move a stage further tonight .
an application to overhaul the vulcan works on guildhall road ( will be looked at by the .
borough council 's .
planning committee .
the grade ii-listed buildings would be transformed into the centre , where there would be at least 16 units for creative industries such as software design and advertising .
the .
university of northampton .
would also take over some of the space .
it 's hoped the centre would help create jobs and boost the economy .

documents.title: case full of war medals stolen in house burglary
text: a display case full of war medals has been stolen from a home in earls barton .

the homeowners returned from a short break to find burglars had taken a burma star medal , with bar and laurel leaf , an argyle and sutherlanders cap badge and a general service medal from northern ireland and oman - along with the case they were in .
the break-in happened at some point between 4 april and 7 april , police said .

documents.title: memorial garden rose plants stolen
text: police in corby say volunteers who look after a memorial garden have been left `` distressed '' by the theft of rose plants .
the roses were taken from the memorial walk area of coronation park at some point last monday night .

`` volunteers look after the park where roses are bought , along with a name plaque , by families wishing to have somewhere quiet to sit and remember their loved ones , '' northamptonshire police said .
`` both the volunteers and the families involved have been left distressed by the theft . ''

documents.title: weather : dry and bright with sunny spells
text: another pleasant day in store across the region , staying dry with bright or sunny spells .
winds will freshen through the day , becoming strong at times over higher ground .
highs today of 14c , that 's 57f .
if you 'd like a detailed forecast for where you live , you can have a look at the bbc weather website .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to tuesday 's live updates for northamptonshire
text: good morning , and welcome to tuesday 's live page for northamptonshire , where we 'll bring you the very latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county from now until 18:00 tonight .
it 's a beautiful morning ( although a little bit on the chilly side ) , as showcased by bbc weather watcher will , who snapped the hazy morning skies in badby earlier on .
we 'll bring you a full weather forecast shortly - stay tuned .
author: Jodie Halford
BBC News

documents.title: our live coverage for today
text: that 's it for live updates today .
we 'll return fully at 08:00 tomorrow , but any breaking news from around northamptonshire will still appear here overnight .
scroll back through the feed to see what 's been going on in the county today .
have a great evening .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: local paper round-up
text: here 's what some of the local papers are reporting on today
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : after showers clear , dry with clear spells
text: apart from a few showers before midnight it 'll be largely dry with clear spells across the bbc east region .
a ground frost could settle in some rural spots in the light winds as temperatures fall as low as 1c ( 34f ) .
however , many places will stay several degrees higher , between 4-7c ( 38-45f ) .
after a cold start , tomorrow will be fine and dry with some spells of sunshine .
the light winds will freshen during the afternoon .
maximum temperature : 15c ( 59f ) .
more details from bbc weather :
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: artist wanted to brighten up university site
text: think of yourself as a budding artist ?
well , this may be right up your street .

the university of northampton is looking for young people from across the county to help create some eye-catching artwork that will displayed on the hoardings surrounding the construction site of its new waterside campus .
it 's after artwork that represents what living in northamptonshire means to you .
that could mean taking inspiration from the county 's buildings , landscapes , favourite places , art or culture .
the university says `` entries will be judged on originality , creativity , boldness and impact '' .

the winning artists will then be invited to come and paint their designs onto the screens , as well as having the opportunity to have a look around the construction site and see the progress that is being made on the new campus .
the chosen artwork will also be entered into the national ivor goodsite hoarding competition , which saw more than 2,800 children take part last year .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: two from lutterworth die in three-vehicle crash
text: a man and a woman from lutterworth have died in a three-vehicle crash on the a5199 welford road , northamptonshire police said .

the crash , which involved blue vauxhall corsa was in collision with a blue hyundai i40 and a white peugeot partner van , occurred last night just over the northamptonshire border , between thornby and creaton .
the driver of the corsa , a 25-year-old man from lutterworth , and one of the corsa 's passengers , a 22-year-old woman from lutterworth , died at the scene .
two further passengers in the corsa and the driver of the hyundai were taken to hospital with suspected serious injuries , the force added .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police hold two minute silence for pc keith palmer
text: officers and staff from northamptonshire police took part in a two minute silence today in memory of pc keith palmer , who was killed in last month 's westminster attack .
deputy chief constable andy frost said : `` today is a very sad day for policing .
`` i pass my condolences to the families of pc keith palmer and the other innocent victims of that tragic attack .

`` it 's really important the policing family nationally comes together , and here in northamptonshire it 's great to see so many staff and officers both at headquarters and hopefully around the county paying their respects . ''
chief constable simon edens was joined by other colleagues from northamptonshire at southwark in london to be part of the ceremony .

documents.title: police after sus brackley fire information
text: making enquiries into a sus fire at the old wood yard mill lane brackley on 03/04/17 .
any info please call 101 quote incident 471
added to the teams regular patrols to deter asb and ofcourse to ensure we speak to anyone in the area about their own safety

documents.title: two killed in crash on a5199
text: we have some information now on the serious collision on the a5199 we mentioned earlier .
sadly , two people were killed in the incident which took place at 20:45 yesterday .
the crash happened between thornby and creaton when a blue vauxhall corsa collided with a blue hyundai i40 and a white peugeot partner van .
the driver of the corsa , a 25-year-old man from lutterworth , and one of the passengers in the corsa , a 22-year-old woman from lutterworth , died at the scene .
two further passengers in the corsa and the driver of the hyundai were taken to hospital with suspected serious injuries .
anyone with information should call the serious collision investigation unit on 101 .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: three vehicle crash on a5199 last night
text: we 're still trying to find out more details about this incident on the a5199 last night .
witnesses have told us it was a serious collision , but we have no more information at this stage .
northamptonshire police were contacted for comment this morning , but we are still awaiting more details .
as soon as we have them , you will .
northantsfire
northantsfire

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: saints ' mallinder still looking for european place
text: northampton saints ' director of rugby jim mallinder says european qualification remains the aim , despite his side 's heartbreaking last gasp defeat at wasps yesterday .
saints lost 32-30 to the aviva premiership leaders .
they currently sit in seventh place , level of 47 points with harlequins with three games left to play .
mallinder said : `` you 've got to try to control the game in the last 10 minutes , and we never really managed that .
`` we 've just got to keep pushing for wins , and hopefully we can secure at least european qualification . ''

documents.title: police search for dog walker who head-butted man
text: police have launched a manhunt after a dog walker head-butted another man .
the incident took place between 11.30 and midday on 3 april at curtlee hill , wootton .
the victim was assaulted after he confronted the dog walker whose pet had knocked his daughter over .
the offender is described as a white man in his mid to late 20s , of medium build , with short , dark hair and facial stubble .
he wore a white t-shirt , dark zip-up top , grey bottoms , a gold chain and a black cap .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: revell returns to action against blades
text: one of the brighter moments from northampton town 's 2-1 defeat to sheffield united at the weekend was the return to action of alex revell .
revell had been out of action since going off injured against mk dons .
he returned as a 70th minute substitute on saturday .
the striker , who has netted six times since signing from the dons at the start of the season , said : `` it has been difficult on and off the pitch .
`` i 've been working really hard and it was nice to get back out there . ''

documents.title: could brexit help our wine industry ?
text: we 've heard lots about the worries business owners have with brexit looming but could it actually benefit one leicestershire business ?
mark and julia bennet from market harborough run a vineyard overlooking pitsford water - that might not sound like wine country but the bennett 's reckon brexit could change that .
julia said : `` i 'm hopeful with what 's happening with currencies and potentially leaving the eu will help our cause because people are going to find imported wine is going to go up in price .
`` who knows what the government will do with regards to our taxes and wine but maybe they 'll see an opportunity to help english producers . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northampton town 'in the blood ' for skipper marc richards
text: northampton town skipper marc richards says he would like to commit his future to the club .
the striker , who .
returned to the cobblers for a second spell in 2014 , has now scored 61 times for the club after .
netting against sheffield united at the weekend .
richards , who is out of contract at the end of the season , said : `` i would love to stay .
that 's in the manager 's hands and the chairman 's hands .
`` i live in the area now .
it 's part of the blood i think .
i would n't have moved my family down if i did n't think there was a connection . ''
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton Sport

documents.title: northants ' chief constable to honour pc keith palmer
text: the funeral of pc keith palmer , who was killed in the westminster attack , will take place in london 's southwark cathedral later .
among those paying tribute will be northamptonshire police 's chief constable simon edens , along with other members of the force .
i 'll join @ twitterid officers & staff to honour pc keith palmer @ twitterid today in london .
# standforkeith

documents.title: knives seized in corby and kettering
text: last week corby police revealed on twitter how they had confiscated a nine-inch knife from a 12-year-old boy .
and today northamptonshire police have been talking about some of the other blades they have found on the streets of corby and kettering .
the tweets below were published this morning by the force 's proactive team - a team of plain-clothed police officers covering the county .
they include a knife recovered in an area where drug dealing was taking place and an axe
another nasty blade seized in corby .
designed to cause damage .

documents.title: weather watchers capture northants in the sun
text: it was a beautiful weekend weather-wise - and our army of weather watchers were out and about capturing northamptonshire in all its glory .
here are some of our favourite

documents.title: weather : cooler with a northerly breeze
text: hopefully you made the most of the summer temperatures over the weekend , but alas they 're not set to continue .
today we 're back to normal - much cooler with a cold front bringing some chillier air through , with a top temperature of about 13c ( 55f ) .
it will be mostly bright this morning , but turning cloudier in the afternoon with some isolated showers .
you can get more at bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning and welcome to our live coverage
text: good morning and welcome to a new week of live updates for northamptonshire .
we 're here throughout the day bringing you the latest news and reaction , as well as sport , leisure , weather and travel .
it 's another fine and sunny day this morning - although we probably wo n't reach the scorching temperatures of the weekend .
your morning 's forecast is next .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News
